Package io.github.ai4ci.abm.policy

package io.github.ai4ci.abm.policy
Policy models for outbreak-level interventions and control strategies.

This package contains implementations of policy-level state machines that model various outbreak control strategies, including monitoring, lockdowns, and reactive interventions based on epidemiological indicators.

Core Components

  • PolicyModel - Base interface for policy state implementations that extend the core State.PolicyState functionality
  • NoControl - Policy state representing no central control, serving as the baseline/default policy
  • ReactiveLockdown - Policy states for reactive lockdown strategies triggered by epidemiological thresholds
  • Trigger - Interface for defining policy activation triggers based on outbreak state metrics

Policy State Machine Patterns

Policy models follow the state machine pattern defined in the mechanics package:

  • Policy states implement State.PolicyState interface
  • State transitions are managed through nextState() method implementations
  • History updates can perform policy-specific actions like population screening
  • Policies can force behavior state transitions across the population

Reactive Lockdown Implementation

The ReactiveLockdown enum provides a complete implementation of a threshold-based policy response system:

  • MONITOR: Passive monitoring with routine screening
  • LOCKDOWN: Active intervention with population-wide behavior restrictions
  • TRANSITION: Intermediate state for policy change management

Trigger Mechanisms

Policies can be activated based on various epidemiological triggers:

  • Test positivity rates
  • Screening test positivity
  • Case incidence thresholds
  • Other outbreak metrics

Integration with Outbreak Modeling

Policy models interact with the broader outbreak simulation framework by:

  • Modifying outbreak state through builder patterns
  • Influencing individual agent behavior via state machine transitions
  • Responding to changing epidemiological conditions
  • Providing decision points for public health intervention simulations

  • Class
    Description
    NoControl
    A no operation policy model where no central control is applied to the outbreak.
    PolicyModel
    Called during an update cycle before any changes have been made This means any references to state refers to current state, but any references to history refer to the previous state.
    ReactiveLockdown
    A reactive lockdown policy implementation that triggers population-wide interventions based on epidemiological thresholds.
    Trigger
    Interface for defining policy activation triggers based on outbreak state metrics.
    Trigger.Value
    Predefined trigger implementations for common outbreak metrics used in policy decisions.
